item.title: First Paranormal Activity: Threshold Gameplay Trailer Is Full Of Found-Footage Scares
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

During today's DreadXP livestream, a spooky new look at the Paranormal Activity video game was revealed. The gameplay teaser for Paranormal Activity: Threshold showed off a taste of what players can expect, as they find themselves stuck inside a haunted house full of hostile entities and puzzles.

The trailer teased an approach similar to the film franchise, as it was full of found-footage shots and a foreboding sense of dread that the film franchise is known for.

DarkStone Digital--the team behind 2022's The Mortuary Assistant--is working on the game, and it'll feature a Haunt System designed to dynamically alter the types and intensity of scares that players will encounter during their sessions.

Publisher DreadXP stated that game director Brian Clarke aims to replicate his signature approach to fear and immersion in the Paranormal Activity game, while also expanding on the franchise's infamous found-footage style horror in "new and nightmarish" ways.

While it doesn't have a release date yet, DreadXP says it will reveal more about Paranormal Activity: Threshold's platforms and launch timing in the months to come. Fans of the film franchise looking for some effective shock treatment can grab a new Blu-ray set of the original movies.

The $50 Blu-ray box set includes all eight movies, starting from the original low-budget thriller up through Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2's Final DLC Launches This November
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Warhorse Studios has one more DLC coming for its action-RPG Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, which we've known since January 2025. Now, though, the Czech developer has not only dropped a new trailer for Mysteria Ecclesia, but also revealed that this last story expansion will launch on November 11 for consoles and PC.

Mysteria Ecclesia sees protagonist Henry of Skalitz (played by The Suspect's Tom McKay) become something of a private investigator as he explores the Sedletz Monastery to follow the clues and search for answers about the spread of a deadly disease. You can check out the brief trailer for the DLC just below.

One of the best RPGs of the year, the game received a superb 9/10 in our Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 review. Critic Richard Wakeling called it a "triumphant sequel," saying, "This is a massively improved sequel in every other area, with better combat, quest design, and none of the technical issues that plagued the original."

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is available now for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. You can get Mysteria Ecclesia and the two other add-ons, Brushes with Death and Legacy of the Forge, through the game's $30 Expansion Pass or $90 Gold Edition.

item.title: Fortnite Will Add Moe From The Simpsons In Next Major Update, It Seems
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Epic Games has yet to officially confirm that the next major Fortnite update will focus on The Simpsons, but the evidence continues to grow. Today, it was reported that Moe Szyslak, the slimy bartended from Moe's Tavern, will have a skin in the forthcoming Simpsons collaboration.

He would join Ned Flanders, who was previously leaked, along with presumably some or all of the main Simpson family members like Homer and Marge.

Moe is one of the best-known and most-recognizable characters from The Simpsons, so him being included with the rumored collab is not a big surprise. The leak, from user Blortzen, said Moe will have a skin in Fortnite and will appear on the map as an NPC. Moe's Tavern will be on the map, too, it seems.

The rumored upcoming Fortnite collaboration with The Simpsons is said to be significant, with Fortnite adding a new map based on Springfield and featuring its various points of interest, like the nuclear power plant where Homer works.

For more, be sure to check out GameSpot's rundown of everything we've heard so far about the rumored Simpsons collaboration with Fortnite. The new season is rumored to begin in early November.

In semi-related news, a fan-made re-skin of The Simpsons Hit & Run focusing on Futurama has drawn the praise of one of the game's original designers.

As for the TV series, The Simpsons debuted in 1989 and is now in its 37th season. The show was renewed earlier this year and will continue through at least Season 40 in 2028-2029. A second Simpsons Movie is coming as well, and it's set for release in July 2027, on the same day as A Minecraft Movie 2.

item.title: Fallout 4 And Fallout: New Vegas Are Getting Anniversary Editions
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Earlier today, Bethesda Game Studios shared its Fallout Day Broadcast. And while there wasn't a new Fallout game, there were a lot of Fallout-related announcements. Coming up first is the Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition, which will arrive just in time for the game's 10th anniversary next month.

Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition will feature 150 pieces of Creation Club content, as well as the six official add-ons, and Creations, which will allow console and PC users to find even more content. The Anniversary Edition is dropping on November 10 for Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PS5, PS4, and PC. If you already have Fallout 4, the Anniversary Upgrade will be available on all platforms. Game Pass and PlayStation Plus subscribers will also have the option to access the DLC and Creations content. Additionally, Fallout 4 Anniversary Edition will be ported to Switch 2 in 2026.

On October 23, the Bethesda Gear Store will be taking preorders for Fallout: New Vegas 15th Anniversary Bundle. This package will only be available for PC players, and it will include a code for Fallout: New Vegas Ultimate Edition, as well as the following collectibles:

  • 8-inch PVC statue of Victor
  • Doc Mitchell's Evaluation Cards
  • Vault Boy enamel pin
  • Mojave Express patch
  • NCR Recon patch
  • Collector's Big Box

It's not the modern remaster of Fallout: New Vegas that actor Danny Trejo really wants to see, but it's a start.

Fallout 76 is set to graduate to the current console generation with new ports for Xbox Series X|S and PlayStation 5 in early 2026. PS4 and Xbox One players will also get new optimizations. In the meantime, Bethesda is launching the Burning Springs update for Fallout 76 on December 2. Walton Goggins will also be reprising his role as The Ghoul from the Fallout TV series for that update, as his character gives players a chance to become bounty hunters.

Finally, the mobile game Fallout Shelter is getting Seasons, which will introduce new limited-time Vaults that will be separate from players' original Vault. Every Season will have its own theme, as well as new rewards and challenges for players to explore.

For Fallout fans who live in the Lone Star state, the Texas Stars of the American Hockey League will celebrate its second annual Fallout Night on Saturday, October 25 at the H-E-B Center at Cedar Park, in Cedar Park, Texas. Fallout cosplayers will be on hand for photo ops, and there will be themed concessions and collectibles for sale.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Coming To Switch 2, And Really Soon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The upcoming Switch 2 port of Assassin's Creed Shadows hasn't exactly been a well-kept secret. Listings popped up online, and there was a leak earlier this month that suggested the release date would be December 5. It turns out that was just off by three days. Ubisoft and Nintendo have now officially revealed that Assassin's Creed Shadows will hit Switch 2 on December 2, and the news was accompanied by a launch trailer.

Despite some rumors that suggested a $70 price to match the other consoles, Switch 2's Assassin's Creed Shadows will retail for $60. However, it will be on a game-key card unless purchased directly from the eShop as a download. There will also be premium edition for $100 that will only be available digitally.

At launch, the Switch 2 port will have all of the content updates released since the game's debut except for the first DLC expansion, Claws of Awaji. Switch 2 users will have to wait until 2026 for that. However, the Switch 2 version will support cross-platform progression through Ubisoft Connect.

"We are delighted to bring Assassin's Creed Shadows to Nintendo players," game director Charles Benoit said in a statement. "Whether slipping through the shadows as Naoe or facing foes head-on as Yasuke, players will be able to roam the streets and rooftops of feudal Japan at home or anywhere their journey takes them on Nintendo Switch 2."

An update released for Shadows in September added a cat dressed like Enzio, one of the fan-favorite characters in the Assassin's Creed franchise. A recent report revealed that Ubisoft began developing an Assassin's Creed title set during the American Civil War and the Reconstruction era. However, the project was canceled because it was considered to be too controversial.
